definition: Central Bank of the Republic of China (Taiwan)
to hit (the mark)/to be hit by/to suffer/to win (a prize, a lottery)
row/line/commercial firm/line of business/profession/to rank (first, second etc) among one's siblings (by age)/(in data tables) row/(Tw) column

to walk/to go/to travel/a visit/temporary/makeshift/current/in circulation/to do/to perform/capable/competent/effective/all right/OK!/will do/behavior/conduct/Taiwan pr. [xing4] for the behavior-conduct sense

pinyin: Ou1 zhou1 Zhong1 yang1 Yin2 hang2

sentences.english: It is the commitment of central bank to smooth the volatility of the foreign exchange market in the short interval.
sentences.chinese: 燙平短期匯市劇烈波動是中央銀行的職責。

sentences.english: The central bank has plans to release a set of coins commemorating the Seediq.
sentences.chinese: 中央銀行計劃發佈一套紀念賽德克族人的硬幣。

sentences.english: The central bank supervises and controls money market.
sentences.chinese: 中央銀行監督控制金融市場。

sentences.english: He was an early believer in central-bank independence, long before this was fashionable.
sentences.chinese: 他還先知先覺地認爲中央銀行應當保持獨立。

sentences.english: The central bank would ideally say no.
sentences.chinese: 中央銀行可以理想地拒絕。

sentences.english: Former Central Bank Governor Ahmed Ould Daddah was third with less than 14 percent.
sentences.chinese: 前中央銀行行長達達赫得票不到14%，位居第三。

sentences.english: They think other central banks will also buy gold for their reserves.
sentences.chinese: 他們認爲，其他中央銀行也將購買黃金作爲儲備。

sentences.english: Central banks failed to address risks building in the new economy.
sentences.chinese: 中央銀行無法應對新經濟中產生的各種風險。

sentences.english: Ratings downgrades of assets guaranteed by Spain’s central bank didn’t help either.
sentences.chinese: 下調西班牙中央銀行擔保資產的評級也無濟於事。

sentences.english: How can you get a central banker to do that?
sentences.chinese: 你怎麼樣使一箇中央銀行家那樣做呢？

sentences.english: Research Advisor, Mexican Central Bank (Banco de México).
sentences.chinese: 墨西哥中央銀行研究顧問。

sentences.english: They need reassuring steps from the governments and the central banks, " said Bergsten.
sentences.chinese: 市場需要政府和中央銀行採取能夠讓人放心的步驟。

sentences.english: And not all of that demand came from central banks either.
sentences.chinese: 而且，並非所有的需求都來自中央銀行的。

sentences.english: At the same time, lowered the central bank refinancing and rediscount interest rates.
sentences.chinese: 同時，降低了中央銀行再貸款和再貼現利率。

sentences.english: An analogy is often drawn between an independent judiciary and an independent central bank.
sentences.chinese: 中央銀行的獨立可以和司法獨立作這樣一個類比。

sentences.english: On a pure gold standard without the central bank, money is gold.
sentences.chinese: 在沒有中央銀行的完全的金本位體系中，錢就是黃金。

definition: to call a conference/to convene a meeting
to underwrite (i.e. guarantee financing)/underwriting/to sell as agent/consignee
(of a pendulum) to stop swinging/(of work, production, activities etc) to come to a halt/to be suspended/to be canceled/shutdown/(sports) lockout
Saudi Arabia (Tw), abbr. for 沙烏地阿拉伯王國|沙乌地阿拉伯王国
